I don't think there's any question, Your Honor, that under today's Commerce Clause jurisprudence, the States would be able to regulate retail deliveries over transmission facilities, particularly within their own States.
But the statute does give the FERC jurisdiction over the transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce.
Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.

Your Honor, Justice Scalia, in response to your question as to whether FERC has given the authority to the State to decide prioritization of curtailment, the answer is no.
